triples.name: Integer programming
triples.relevance: Integer programming is the mathematical framework underlying SCIP's constraint integer programming approach.

triples.name: Linear programming
triples.relevance: Linear programming provides the relaxation methods and core techniques used in SCIP's solving algorithms.

triples.name: Branch and bound
triples.relevance: Branch and bound is a fundamental algorithm used by SCIP for solving integer programming problems.

triples.name: Cutting-plane method
triples.relevance: Cutting planes are a key technique in SCIP's branch-and-cut algorithm for integer programming.

triples.name: Benders decomposition
triples.relevance: Benders decomposition is improved in SCIP 7.0 for solving structured optimization problems.

triples.name: Semidefinite programming
triples.relevance: SCIP-SDP solver handles mixed-integer semidefinite programming problems combining these paradigms.

triples.name: Symmetry-breaking constraints
triples.relevance: Symmetry handling is substantially improved in SCIP 7.0 to reduce search space in optimization problems.

triples.name: Mathematical optimization
triples.relevance: Mathematical optimization is the overarching field in which SCIP operates as a general-purpose solver.

triples.name: Parallel computing
triples.relevance: SCIP 7.0 introduces the parallel presolving library PaPILO as a new feature for parallel problem simplification.

triples.name: Heuristic
triples.relevance: SCIP 7.0 improves primal heuristics which find good candidate solutions without guaranteeing optimality.
